utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Cranial nerves. On old Olympus' towering tops a friendly Viking grew vines and hops. Olfactory. Optic. Oculomotor.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Vagus. Accessory. Causes of edema: A.L.I.V.E. Allergic…

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Differentials for swollen scrotum: T.H.E.A.T.R.E.S. English spelling. Torsion, hernia…

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Epididymal cyst. S-syphilis.

utterance.speaker: Donovan
utterance.content: Enough with the drilling. We're third year. No more exams.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: You don't have to face House every day.

utterance.speaker: Donovan
utterance.content: And after today, neither do you. Here's to no more coming home in tears.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: It's kind of like coming to the end of an extreme roller-coaster. Even with the terror, nausea, and whiplash. I'm a little sad that it's over.

utterance.speaker: Donovan
utterance.content: Let's go. You got your procedure log?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Oh, I'm not quite done. I still have one more lumbar puncture.

utterance.speaker: Donovan
utterance.content: It's due today. Unless you want to blow off becoming a doctor and get another PhD.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: I know. I'm gonna get it done.

utterance.speaker: Donovan
utterance.content: I thought you'd have that thing finished like six months ago.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: I've been busy.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Oh, come on, Cruz. Let me do this. I need it for my log.

utterance.speaker: Cruz
utterance.content: Wait, you aren't done yet?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: I've been busy.

utterance.speaker: Cruz
utterance.content: What's in it for me?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: The satisfaction that comes from helping out a classmate? How about cash?

utterance.speaker: Donovan
utterance.content: Have you talked to House?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: It's 6:00 am. He won't be in for a few hours. I keep a roll of quarters in the car…

utterance.speaker: Donovan
utterance.content: I just turned in my log and guess what I saw. There's an opening in the Diagnostics Department.

utterance.speaker: Cruz
utterance.content: House wants an intern?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: He's never had one before.

utterance.speaker: Donovan
utterance.content: You gotta figure he doesn't want an intern. He wants you.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Uh, you must be Dr… Thirteen.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Remy Hadley. Nice to meet you.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: You're back.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: What the hell happened to you? Why'd you lie about going to Rome?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You'd lie too if you bottomed out, ended up in… drug rehab.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Thank you, House, for respecting my privacy. What a perfect reminder that I'm back.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I didn't even know you had a problem.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Loved ones are always the last to know. Loved ones and robotic, estranged ex-boyfriends. Our patient is Kendall Pearson. 16-year-old aspiring pirate.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: She's that Canadian kid who's trying to be the youngest person to sail around the world.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Collapsed yesterday during a practice run. Luckily for us, cameras were there. Corporate sponsors want us to check that's she seaworthy before the clock strikes "you're too old to set a record." Gives us three days. You've still only got one, right?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Uh, last day as a student. Could be simple dehydration. She told the Coast Guard she had felt dizzy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Pulse and BP were normal at the time of the rescue. It's not dehydration. What about your internship? You sign up this morning?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Actually, I'm still deciding. Uh. Maybe she had a seizure and that's what caused her collapse.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Coast Guard report says no sign of head trauma.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: But what about her back? Look. Right before the collapse, she hit the small of her back on the railing. Damaged adrenal glands caused adrenal insufficiencies, which caused the collapse.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nice. Blood draws every 15 minutes for four hours. Let's track her cortisol. Masters, there's no hurry. There's no wrong choices. At least, that's what they tell people who make crappy choices.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: What's with the sudden interest in her future?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You know, a blacksmith who spends this much time hammering out a new blade from raw Jell-O… gets curious about who ends up wielding it.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: No reason to be curious unless you're interested in wielding it yourself. You want her to intern here.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: And you're considering this?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Before I make my decision, I still have one more LP I need to get. So I'd like to go to the E.R.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Thirteen, why don't you take Masters to do the blood draws. You can remind her about all the perks of working for me.

utterance.speaker: Kendall
utterance.content: Behind the deck. Port side.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: If her adrenal hormone levels are consistently low, we'll replace them. You'll be ready to launch Thursday.

utterance.speaker: Kendall
utterance.content: Great. Inside cabin facing the bow.

utterance.speaker: Bobby
utterance.content: Sorry, K, I need to borrow mom.

utterance.speaker: Paige
utterance.content: The sponsors?

utterance.speaker: Bobby
utterance.content: No, Couric's people kicking up a fuss about rescheduling the interview.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: I can take over.

utterance.speaker: Kendall
utterance.content: Ceiling of the galley.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Right. The last time I was on a boat was my freshman mixer in college. I didn't so much mix as hurl.

utterance.speaker: Kendall
utterance.content: Too much to drink?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: No, I was 13.

utterance.speaker: Kendall
utterance.content: And in college?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Yeah, I know. Weird.

utterance.speaker: Kendall
utterance.content: I was thinking "cool."

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: We'll be back for the next blood draw in 15 minutes. Unless, of course, you'd like to stay and continue bonding over your lost childhoods.

utterance.speaker: Kendall
utterance.content: Listen, I have a ton of prep work to do to be ready to launch. Is there any way

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Mm, I'm afraid not.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Unless you're up for getting on a treadmill. We could stress her body. See if her adrenals respond. It would only take a half an hour.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: It's about an LP.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Go. I'll handle this.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Um, Dr. Cuddy, can I come by your office later? I'd love to get some advice.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Uh, I-I'm in meetings all afternoon. Try me tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Tomorrow? This is… this is my last day as a medical student. So I've got this decision to make. Probably the biggest decision of my career. Which means maybe the biggest decision of my life. Although, I guess, if I get married… Um, House has opened up an internship.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You do realize if you take it, he'll probably end up firing you again?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: He's always hired me back.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: And he'll continue mocking and insulting you whatever chance he gets.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: It's certainly toughened me up. You're trying to get me to say good things about him.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: No. I'm trying to make you make your own decision and leave me alone. Working with House is great. And it sucks. Often simultaneously. Most people can't work in that environment. Question is… can you?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Thanks, Dr. Cuddy.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: You paged me down here and now you're doing my LP?

utterance.speaker: Cruz
utterance.content: I got bored waiting.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: It's been two minutes. This is your 11th.

utterance.speaker: Cruz
utterance.content: 14th. Listen, your roommate, is she hooking up with that resident?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: I got to find House.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Rehab? Great cover story. Now I can't ever drink around those guys again, thus eliminating my main bond with Chase.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Save the attitude for someone who didn't just get you your medical license back. Price you pay.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: There's a chicken in your office.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, there isn't.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: You lied about rehab?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Oh, great.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Relax. She's completely honest, but also completely boring. Watch this. Don't tell anyone.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Of course not. You did an LP? Why didn't you page me?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh, I'm sorry. Did you want to do one of those? You should've spoken up. You want the job or not?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Um, I… after careful consideration, I have decided to accept your offer for an internship.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Great. My department has a slightly different procedure log.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Uh, you forged the last one. I only did nine LPs.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Do you know how to do an LP?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Of course.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Do you know how to do nine LPs and say it was ten? It's time to grow up. Turn that in, the job's yours. Stop staring blankly and go. No doubt something horrible has just happened to our patient.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Her hand turned completely blue during the treadmill test. We put her on vasodilators. Restored enough blood flow so she won't lose any fingers.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Rules out adrenal insufficiency. Where's House? He said to meet him here.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: His chicken's gone.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Probably on the balcony.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: You knew he had a chicken? How come—?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Down here! Loss of consciousness plus she's slowly turning blue. Can we rule out magical gum?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Low cardiac output can cause both. Patient possibly has cardiomyopathy. Possibly caused by Mercury poisoning from all the tuna fish she eats at sea.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Uh, why are you putting, um, chicken footprints on the floor?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That clever bastard Wilson got a hold of an Australorp.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Ah.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Hello? The quietest and calmest of all the chickens.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Damn him. Mercury poisoning is out. Red blood cells have normal morphology.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Raynaud's. Vasospasm in the ulnar artery would explain the hand.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: But not the loss of consciousness. Cerebral vasospasm explains both.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Cerebral vasospasm makes sense. Take Thirteen. Give the patient a calcium channel blocker infusion in the basilar artery. Masters. I thought you were going to turn that in.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Um, I, um, been busy with my patient.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're not busy now. Bawwwwwwk bawk.

utterance.speaker: Donovan
utterance.content: Masters. Still haven't turned in your log?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Still haven't gotten my tenth LP.

utterance.speaker: Donovan
utterance.content: I was thinking maybe you should take House's internship.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: First you act like it's the equivalent of volunteering to be waterboarded and now you're supporting it?

utterance.speaker: Donovan
utterance.content: You're weird. You make paper airplanes for fun and hang them from the ceiling. You have a membership to the Einstein Museum and an overbearing obsession with facial symmetry.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: It indicates freedom from disease. We're biologically programmed to—

utterance.speaker: Donovan
utterance.content: The point is you rub people the wrong way. But House is okay with your lack of bedside manner. He's okay with your willingness to argue any point with anyone even if they outrank you. He's okay with your peculiar fashion sense.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: It's peculiar?

utterance.speaker: Donovan
utterance.content: House doesn't think you're weird, which is weird, but good weird. Is that a chicken?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: I think it's an Australorp. I'm gonna go check on my patient.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Can someone please explain to me what House and Wilson are doing with those chickens?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: They have a bet to see who can keep a chicken in the hospital the longest without getting busted by security. Advancing past the vertebral artery.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: And why are they doing this?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: The place they bought them only had one pig. I'm glad you're gonna be sticking around after today.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Really? You want me to stay?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It's good to add a different perspective to the department. Someone who still remembers there are rules other than House's.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: If I don't play by House's rules, he won't let me in.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Find a way around them.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: I'd have to lie to him, which is still lying.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Lying about a lie, that's practically telling the truth. Catheter's in. Start the calcium channel blocker drip.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Means I need another LP.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Luckily, I know where you can get one. You good here? Let's go.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Mm. Decent stick. Very smooth.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Sounds like you've had a few of these. Suppose that comes with the territory.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I have Huntington's. No need to get hushed and solemn about it.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Why are you lying about rehab?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Because the real reason I was gone is not something I want to share.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Couldn't you just say that? Should be enough for Foreman and the others.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: How long have you worked here? House's people have personalities that range from nosy to "pardon me while I do this cavity search."

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Do you think there's room for someone who does things differently?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: No. Not unless House decides that's what he wants.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: During catheter removal, I got a good look at her cerebral midline. Pineal gland is calcified.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Case closed. I'll start her on hormone therapy. Ship her out.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: I handed in my log.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: On your way to do that, did you happen to stop and give Thirteen an LP? Thirteen's stiff gate, small pupils, and the raging headache she's hiding gave you away.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Yes. And I still broke a rule.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: My rule. Told you to defy the man. Not this man.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Why is it so wrong that I don't like to cheat?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Can we go?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No. Not liking it is fine. Not doing what you don't like makes you an eight-year-old. Wastes your potential.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: You want me to be like you. It's not going to happen.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That's the last thing I want. 'Cause then neither one of us would be exceptional.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: You think I'm exceptional?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not anymore.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: I can do my job without compromising.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, you can't. 'Cause I'm not gonna let you. Internship's gone. It's time for Masters to say good-bye. Enjoy being a surgeon. You'll be fine.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Surgery. Anatomy. Branches off the subclavian artery. Vitamin C and D. V-I-T. Vitamin. V: Vertebral. I: Internal carotid — internal thoracic. Internal thoracic. T: Thyrocervical. C: Costocervical.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Martha M. Masters. That's me. I'm gonna be a surgeon.

utterance.speaker: Guard
utterance.content: Next.

utterance.speaker: Simpson
utterance.content: Welcome to your surgical internship at P.P.T.H. The senior residents stand behind you. We'll all get to know each other soon enough. Grab a donut and get to work.

utterance.speaker: Resident
utterance.content: We're out of donuts.

utterance.speaker: Simpson
utterance.content: Then, uh, get to work.

utterance.speaker: Simpson
utterance.content: Little oozing. Isolated the left subclavian.

utterance.speaker: Resident
utterance.content: Suction.

utterance.speaker: Simpson
utterance.content: You got to do better than that. Can't see a thing.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Push calcium chloride. It will supercharge the platelets and increase the clotting.

utterance.speaker: Simpson
utterance.content: Two amps calcium chloride. Tell the blood bank to set up three units of packed red cells. Field is clear. Nice.

utterance.speaker: Simpson
utterance.content: Generally speaking, pledges aren't supposed to talk unless they ask a question. That's because, generally speaking, pledges don't have anything to say.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Um, K.P. Is that patient Kendall Pearson? I thought she was discharged.

utterance.speaker: Simpson
utterance.content: Mm. It's a House case. I never know what that guy's up to. I want you to scrub in on my lung harvest.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: But it's my first day.

utterance.speaker: Simpson
utterance.content: Yes, I know. I was there. Be scrubbed and ready in 15 minutes.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: What happened? Last I heard, you were going home.

utterance.speaker: Bobby
utterance.content: Kendall collapsed in the parking lot. They're doing something called a "sympathectomy."

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: She must've had a hypertensive crisis caused by a neural overstimulation in her kidneys. So they're cutting the nerves. It's like cutting the gas line to an engine.

utterance.speaker: Bobby
utterance.content: Yeah, sounds like what Dr. Taub said. Said it's basic surgery, but…

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: It is. You should still be on pace for a launch in 36 hours.

utterance.speaker: Bobby
utterance.content: Her mom's packing the boat now. I'm supposed to pick up some dry ice. But…

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Nothing you can do for her here.

utterance.speaker: Boby
utterance.content: Um… we're just trying to help our daughter reach her dream.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: She's different. So you have to be different. I'll make sure she's okay.

utterance.speaker: Bobby
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: Simpson
utterance.content: You can see the full lobular structure of the left lung.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Bifurcate innominate artery. I've never seen one of those before.

utterance.speaker: Simpson
utterance.content: Hold this, Masters.

utterance.speaker: Resident
utterance.content: Rib spreaders.

utterance.speaker: Nurse Hoffner
utterance.content: You guys okay if I pull a circulating nurse? We got a train wreck in O.R. ten.

utterance.speaker: Simpson
utterance.content: You got it. Proximal end attached.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Can someone take the retractors from me?

utterance.speaker: Simpson
utterance.content: Not really.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: I have to use the bathroom.

utterance.speaker: Resident
utterance.content: I know you're a rookie, but you got to be kidding.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: I'm not.

utterance.speaker: Simpson
utterance.content: It can wait.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: I'm gonna have an accident.

utterance.speaker: Simpson
utterance.content: Next one in line, grab it.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: What's wrong?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Hypotension. Low cardiac output. Float the swan.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Don't you have your own surgery?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: I took a break. I told them I had to pee.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You lied. Small one. But it's a gateway lie.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: I care about the patient.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Another lie. You care about being exceptional.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: I told her dad I was gonna take care of her.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: A third lie. Welcome to the slippery slope.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: RA is 8. Equalization of pressures.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Means she has restrictive pericarditis.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Add that to a calcified pineal gland.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: When is a calcified pineal gland not a calcified pineal gland? I realize, technically, it's never, but—

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: When it's a granuloma. It's Wegener's. We should start her on steroids.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: But she had a high CK. Wegener's wouldn't explain the—

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Dehydration does.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Yes. But the calcified pineal could be sarcoidosis.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You had me at "I had to pee." But Thirteen's right. Start her on three fold immunosuppressants. Masters, if you want to fight me on this, fill out a consult form so you can stick around. Welcome back.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: I'm not back! I'll just be staying for this case.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You got really good at this lying thing.

utterance.speaker: Simpson
utterance.content: Hope it was one hell of a whiz.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: I ran into Dr. House. He requested a surgical consult for his patient.

utterance.speaker: Simpson
utterance.content: House never asks for a consult.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Something about this case, he needed a little more help.

utterance.speaker: Simpson
utterance.content: First day of your surgical internship, you want to be loaned out to another department. Interesting career move. Drop the form by my office. Don't stay away too long. I'm already well on my way to forgetting you.

utterance.speaker: Cruz
utterance.content: How about I take both you lovely ladies out for a drink?

utterance.speaker: Donovan
utterance.content: I'd love to. Except I think you're a cretin. And the last time she was at a bar was ballet class.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: I didn't take — Oh. That's funny. I'm gonna stay and run a few extra tests on House's patient. This one lab value doesn't make sense to me.

utterance.speaker: Donovan
utterance.content: You're back with House?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Mm. Just this one case. I'm not staying.

utterance.speaker: Cruz
utterance.content: I would kill for a chance to work with him. Like, literally skin you and wear you as a disguise.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Oh!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You want yours extra crispy or original recipe?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Chickens!

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: You ever get sick from poultry?

utterance.speaker: Kendall
utterance.content: Um, a few months ago from this pheasant-in-a-can my dad got me as a joke. You think that's why I'm sick?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: I think that can was chock-full of a bacteria called salmonella enteritis. Likes to hang out in the bones. Let me know if any of this is tender or painful.

utterance.speaker: Kendall
utterance.content: Um, this bacteria thing, is this good news or bad?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Well, if I'm right, that means all you'll need are antibiotics. And you'll be, uh, well, shipshape. Sorry. Couldn't resist. Did you always know that sailing was it for you? That it was the right thing?

utterance.speaker: Kendall
utterance.content: Didn't even start till I was ten. And at first, I was not a fan. Certainly there's plenty not to like about sailing.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: But now that you're so into it…

utterance.speaker: Kendall
utterance.content: Oh, no, there's still plenty of things I hate about it. I hate being wet. I hate being cold. I hate eating nothing but freeze-dried food.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: That is quite the endorsement.

utterance.speaker: Kendall
utterance.content: Sailing is amazing. But doesn't mean I love every second on the boat. Doing what you love means dealing with things you don't. If there were nothing to overcome, it might not be that— Ow.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Salmonella enteritis is a nice catch.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Thanks. Starting on the soft tissue windows.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Once this case is over, you going back to surgery?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: That's the plan.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I think that's a mistake. I think you should go back to surgery.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: I just said I was.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: No. You said it was your plan. Which means House might be right. And you might be lying to yourself.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Would it be so terrible? You chose House over surgery.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: My time here changed me in ways not everyone in my life thought was for the better. No masses. Moving on to bone windows.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Were those people right?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I think when you do change, it's not so simple to go back. There. In the humerus.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Doesn't look like an infection.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: That's because it looks like cancer.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: You have lymphoid sarcoma. A cancer in the bone in your arm.

utterance.speaker: Kendall
utterance.content: Am I going to be okay?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: It's a treatable cancer. But part of that treatment involves amputating your arm. I'm sorry.

utterance.speaker: Kendall
utterance.content: There's nothing else?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Um.… we can do chemo and radiation after the amputation.

utterance.speaker: Kendall
utterance.content: I don't mean after. I mean instead of. If I leave soon, I still have time to break the record.

utterance.speaker: Bobby
utterance.content: Honey, you can't be serious.

utterance.speaker: Kendall
utterance.content: I feel fine. Last night, they thought it was an infection.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: We know it's cancer. We ran the biopsy three times.

utterance.speaker: Kendall
utterance.content: You don't know how fast—

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Postponing the surgery could increase the likelihood that the cancer will spread.

utterance.speaker: Paige
utterance.content: Kendall, you need to think about what the doctor's saying.

utterance.speaker: Kendall
utterance.content: I'm thinking about the sail. Like I have since I was ten. Don't take this away from me. It's just a month. I can take extra precautions. I'll Skype you every day and I can fly back if something goes wrong.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: She'll be risking her life.

utterance.speaker: Paige
utterance.content: I think we need to discuss this as a family.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: You're considering this? Your daughter's condition—

utterance.speaker: Paige
utterance.content: Thank you, Dr. Masters.

utterance.speaker: Bobby
utterance.content: She's not budging. She wants to launch tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: She's a minor. You sign the consent form, we can do the surgery. Amputation can be an emo—

utterance.speaker: Bobby
utterance.content: She's talked my wife into agreeing with her.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: One parent's signature is enough. She needs you to be a parent.

utterance.speaker: Bobby
utterance.content: You're asking me to blow up my family.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: I'm asking you to save your family.

utterance.speaker: Bobby
utterance.content: On her first solo Atlantic crossing, she scheduled a court date to become an emancipated minor. She'll do it again and she'll win. She is gonna do what she's gonna do with or without me. I'd rather have it be with.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: I'm stuck.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No, you're not. Case is over. You're back to surgery. And fetch. Oh, that's a good boy. Oh, that's a good boy. Hey, good boy.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: No one will stop Kendall's sail. You need to step in.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Sign on the door says I'm a diagnostician. Cool diagnosis means I'm finished.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: She could die.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Pretty sure the law of the land states that everyone has the right to be an idiot. Uh! I think it's the second amendment. Fetch! Bring it here, boy. Who's a good boy?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: You are constantly railing against hypocrisy, forcing people to face the truth. This time nothing?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah. 'Cause they faced the truth.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: And made a decision that will in all likelihood kill their daughter.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm fine with that. I wanted a diagnosis. I got it. What do you want?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: I don't want her to die.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Break the rules.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: I can't.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So coloring inside the lines is more important to you than saving this girl's life? I was wrong about one thing, you are not exceptional. And fetch! Ho ho ho. Oh, that's a good boy. Good boy. Good boy.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Dr. Wilson. Um, I'd like to get your advice about a cancer patient.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Kendall Pearson. Oncology rounds. Everyone's talking about it. Oh.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Are you okay?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Yeah, my back's acting up.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Oh. Um… so what would you do?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I would keep trying to convince her to have the surgery.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: And if she kept saying no?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I would just keep— Keep — keep trying.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: I know there's a chicken under there.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Oh, thank God. It's pecked through one pair of my loafers.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: So that's all you'd do?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: That's all you can do.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Is it? Isn't that House's chicken?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Disgusting beasts. I don't know why I ever agreed to this bet.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: So call it off.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: And lose $20? Listen, House was in the exact same situation Kendall's in. He needed surgery, but he didn't want it. Once he was in medically-induced coma, his girlfriend signed the consent form as his proxy. They went ahead with the surgery against his will. Probably saved his life.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: So she did the right thing?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Depends on who you ask.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Fetch!

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: No! No!

utterance.speaker: Guard
utterance.content: Excuse me. Who's responsible for this chicken? Does anyone know who owns the chicken?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: That bird belongs to… Dr. Gregory House.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: You need to do this surgery.

utterance.speaker: Kendall
utterance.content: I will.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Now.

utterance.speaker: Kendall
utterance.content: We've been through this. I'm leaving today.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: It's a stupid record.

utterance.speaker: Kendall
utterance.content: It's not about the record. I used to race against other people. I could have the slowest boat in the fleet and I'd win.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: So it's about being better than everyone else?

utterance.speaker: Kendall
utterance.content: It has nothing to do with anybody except me. The other racers would think I was crazy. I'd set off on some tacking angle that made no sense to them because they couldn't see what I saw. I could sense the changes in the wind before they even happened. At the top of the game, you play by different rules.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Medicine's gonna burn a little bit.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Bradycardic arrest. Third degree heart block.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Likely paraneoplastic syndrome.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We need to get her to the O.R. For pacemaker or plasmapheresis.

utterance.speaker: Paige
utterance.content: What's going on?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: The cancer is causing her heart to slow down. We have to get her to the O.R. and treat her. This is what I was worried about. If this had happened at sea, she would be dead.

utterance.speaker: Paige
utterance.content: Oh, my God.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: We need you to sign the consent form. Authorize us to amputate her arm.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Subclavian access established.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Temporary pacer ready.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Don't need it. Push calcium chloride. It'll fix the heart block. Bradycardia was me.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You did this?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Parents signed the consent form. Amputate her arm.

utterance.speaker: Kendall
utterance.content: What happened?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: You had a cardiac episode that required us to bring you into the O.R. That crisis resolved, but—

utterance.speaker: Kendall
utterance.content: What did you do? What did you do?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: During surgery, we found cancer in a lymph node in your neck.

utterance.speaker: Kendall
utterance.content: So you cut off my arm?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Cancer was already spreading. It had to be done.

utterance.speaker: Kendall
utterance.content: I told you I didn't want this.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: If we had waited until after the sail was over you would have died.

utterance.speaker: Kendall
utterance.content: That record. That was everything.

utterance.speaker: Bobby
utterance.content: It wasn't everything. You have a life. A future.

utterance.speaker: Kendall
utterance.content: You weren't supposed to do this. How could you?

utterance.speaker: Paige
utterance.content: Because we love you.

utterance.speaker: Kendall
utterance.content: I hate you. I hate both of you.

utterance.speaker: Bobby
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Kendall
utterance.content: My arm. My arm.

utterance.speaker: Paige
utterance.content: Dr. Masters, thank you.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Someone has got their pouty face on.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: I did things no doctor in their right mind would do.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Good.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: I manipulated, lied, forged, stole.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I don't want to know the specifics. Might be called to testify.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: I broke the rules because I believed I was right.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You were right.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Then why don't I feel good or satisfied? Instead, I just feel like throwing up.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And you're following me to ask how I break the rules and maintain my rosy demeanor.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: I didn't do it to be happy. I just thought I would be.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Well, you can't always get what you want. To the victor of the spoils. Your bird recover okay?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Physically, yes. Emotionally, it was a long night. Next week: Ferrets?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: House. I can't do it. I'm leaving.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Surgery?

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: I… don't know what I'm going to do. But I do know I don't want to be here.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Nothing will ever be simple again.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: I'm fine with that.

utterance.speaker: Masters
utterance.content: Ooop.
